purpleculture_pinyin:
dì
stem (of fruit)
стебель (плод)
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 帝 indicates the sound; 艹 (plant) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
根深蒂固 [ gēn shēn dì gù ]: deep-rooted (problem etc)
烟蒂 [ yān dì ]: cigarette butt
芥蒂 [ jiè dì ]: an obstruction; barrier; ill-feeling; grudge
瓜熟蒂落 [ guā shú dì luò ]: when the melon is ripe, it falls (idiom); problems sort themselves out in the fullness of time
罗曼蒂克 [ luó màn dì kè ]: romantic (loanword)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 艹 [ cǎo ] grass, weed, plant, herb
    • 帝 [ dì ] supreme ruler, emperor; god
heisig_chinese_memo: The sovereign ate the poison fruit (flower) you gave him and now he's laying on the ground with only a fruit stem next to him. &nbsp
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The sovereign ate the poison fruit (flower) you gave him and now he's laying on the ground with only a fruit stem next to him. &nbsp
humanum_full_description_en:
From "艸", " Emperor " sound. "Suo Wen" is used as " di " and later " di ". The original meaning is the part connecting flowers, fruits and branches. For example, Wang Bo of the Tang Dynasty "Pairing Lotus Songs": "Pair the flowers and pity the stalk, fold the lotus root and love Liansi." "Old Tang Book. "Yangcheng Biography": "Those who have Xue Yue, tasted learning in the city, are sexually frantic, offend by words, move to Lianzhou, send guests without roots, and Taiwan officials ask for what they can get from the city."

The idiom "deep rooted" has a solid metaphorical foundation and cannot be shaken. Such as Ling Zhuchu of the Ming Dynasty, "The first cut to make a case is surprising. Volume 22": "Nowadays, there are many officials who are difficult to do. Most of the people they have done are rooted and strong; relatives are full of dynasties, the party and the four cloths, and then they can be deeply rooted and earn money. Do higher." "Manuscript of Qing History. "Biography of Cen Yuying": "Du Wenxiu has been stealthily for ten years and has deep roots."
humanum_short_description_en: From "艸", " Emperor " sound. The original meaning is the part connecting flowers, fruits and branches.
humanum_full_description:
從「艸」，「帝」聲。《說文》作「蔕」，後作「蒂」。本義是花、瓜果與枝莖相連的部分。如唐代王勃〈採蓮曲〉：「牽花憐共蒂，折藕愛連絲。」《舊唐書．陽城傳》：「有薛約者，嘗學於城，性狂躁，以言事得罪，徙連州，客寄無根蒂，臺吏以蹤跡求得之於城家。」

　　成語「根深蒂固」比喻基礎牢固，不可動搖。如明代凌濛初《初刻拍案驚奇．卷二十二》：「而今的官，有好些難做。他們做得興頭的，多是有根基，有腳力；親戚滿朝，黨與四布，方能勾根深蒂固，有得錢賺，越做越高。」《清史稿．岑毓英傳》：「杜文秀竊踞迤西十有三載，根深蒂固。」
humanum_short_description: 從「艸」，「帝」聲。本義是花、瓜果與枝莖相連的部分。

Chinese: The sovereign ate the poison fruit (flower) you gave him and now he's laying on the ground with only a fruit stem next to him.  
Meaning: fruit stem
Story: The sovereign ate the poison fruit (flower) you gave him and now he's laying on the ground with only a fruit stem next to him.  
Kind: both

從「 艸 」，「 帝 」聲。《說文》作「 蔕 」，後作「 蒂 」。本義是花、瓜果與枝莖相連的部分。如唐代王勃〈採蓮曲〉：「牽花憐共蒂，折藕愛連絲。」《舊唐書．陽城傳》：「有薛約者，嘗學於城，性狂躁，以言事得罪，徙連州，客寄無根蒂，臺吏以蹤跡求得之於城家。」 成語「根深蒂固」比喻基礎牢固，不可動搖。如明代凌濛初《初刻拍案驚奇．卷二十二》：「而今的官，有好些難做。他們做得興頭的，多是有根基，有腳力；親戚滿朝，黨與四布，方能勾根深蒂固，有得錢賺，越做越高。」《清史稿．岑毓英傳》：「杜文秀竊踞迤西十有三載，根深蒂固。」
From " 艸", " Emperor" sound. "Suo Wen" is used as " di" and later " di". The original meaning is the part connecting flowers, fruits and branches. For example, Wang Bo of the Tang Dynasty "Pairing Lotus Songs": "Pair the flowers and pity the stalk, fold the lotus root and love Liansi." "Old Tang Book. "Yangcheng Biography": "Those who have Xue Yue, tasted learning in the city, are sexually frantic, offend by words, move to Lianzhou, send guests without roots, and Taiwan officials ask for what they can get from the city." The idiom "deep rooted" has a solid metaphorical foundation and cannot be shaken. Such as Ling Zhuchu of the Ming Dynasty, "The first cut to make a case is surprising. Volume 22": "Nowadays, there are many officials who are difficult to do. Most of the people they have done are rooted and strong; relatives are full of dynasties, the party and the four cloths, and then they can be deeply rooted and earn money. Do higher." "Manuscript of Qing History. "Biography of Cen Yuying": "Du Wenxiu has been stealthily for ten years and has deep roots."

蒂字的基本解释

蒂
dì
花或瓜果跟枝茎相连的部分：花蒂。瓜蒂。蒂芥。根深蒂固。

蒂字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dì］
［《廣韻》都計切，去霽，端。］
亦作“蒂1”。
(1)花或瓜果与枝茎相连的部分。
(2)种植。
(3)量词（用于瓜果）。

蒂字的英文翻译

◎ 蒂
pedicel

蒂字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　蒂； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1047第32
同蔕。【班固·答賔戲】上無所蒂，下無所根。

蒂字的源字形

蒂字的起名意思

：本义指花、叶或瓜、果与枝茎连结的部分；后引申为末尾，本原。

Pedicle
Basic explanation of words
Pedicle
dì
The part where the flower or fruit is connected to the stem: the flower pedicle. Guardy. Stubble. ingrained.
Pedicle
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dì］
["Guangyun" all plan to cut, go to Ji, end. ]
Also known as "Tie 1".
(1) The part where the flower or fruit is connected to the stem.
(2) Planting.
(3) Quantifiers (for melons and fruits).

[Shen Ji 1] [Department of Zodiac Words] 　Di; Kangxi strokes: 15; Page number: page 1047 32
Tong Di. [Banggu·Anping Opera] There is no root in the upper part, and no root in the lower part.
Pedicle
Source glyph
Pedicle
Name meaning
: The original meaning refers to the part where flowers, leaves or melons, fruits and branches and stems are connected; the latter is extended to the end, the original.
蒂
会意字。从艸(+),其古文字形体像草,表示蒂与植物有关,是花或瓜果与枝茎连接部分;从帝,帝是蒂的初文,其形像
花蒂;帝(d)兼表声。蒂是花或瓜果和枝茎相连的部分。
瓜或果与枝茎相连的部分:花~「瓜熟~落。
~固 瓜~ 茧~ 芥~ 落~ 柿~ 烟~ 并~莲
根深~固 罗曼~克 归根结~
dì
希。
蒂。
楷
萧
Ножка
Зная слово.
Congqi (+), его древние символы похожи на траву, что указывает на то, что стебель связан с растениями и является соединительной частью цветов или фруктов и ветвей; Congdi, первый текст на ножке, и его изображение похоже на цветочную ножку ; Император (г) и Столовое звучание.
Цветоножка - это часть соединения цветка или плода и стебля.
Та часть, где дыня или плод соединяется со стеблем: цветок ~ "спелая дыня ~ осень".
~ Твердая дыня ~ Кокон ~ Горчица ~ Падающая ~ Хурма ~ Дым ~ Консолидация ~ Глубокие корни лотоса ~ Твердый луоман ~ Грамм до конца ~
надеяться.
Ножка.
Кай
Сяо
dì
плодоножка, цветоножка; стебель
